analysis.Summary: Vue 3 single-file component that renders a refresh icon as inline SVG, with a customizable fill color via a prop.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a reusable 'refresh' icon for navigation or UI controls within the Martyrs-based application.

Components.name: IconRefresh
Components.responsibility: Encapsulates SVG markup for a refresh icon and exposes a 'fill' prop to control its color.

Dependencies: Global CSS variable: --black (used in default fill value)
analysis.Usage: Imported and used in other components or views: import IconRefresh from '@/modules/icons/navigation/IconRefresh.vue'; then used in template as <IconRefresh fill="#FF0000"/>.
Notes: Uses Vue 3 <script setup> syntax and defineProps for prop declaration.
The default fill value is defined as an object ({ position: 'rgb(var(--black))' }) despite prop type String â€” likely a typo or bug; should be a string.
No <style> block is present; styling is driven entirely by SVG attributes and global CSS variables.
SVG viewBox and path data are hard-coded, so any size adjustments must be done via width/height props or external CSS overrides.
